content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────
### Resource Depot & Smelting Facility at base position (x=-4.5, y=18.5)
Consists of:
• Wooden Chest at (x=-4.5, y=18.5) serving as central storage.
• Stone Furnace at (x=-3.0, y=19.0) for iron smelting.
• Stone Furnace at (x=-4.0, y=21.0) for copper plate production.
• Burner Inserter at (x=0.5, y=21.5) with drop at (x=0.5, y=20.5).

### Automation Lab & Steam Power System (Integrated System) at base configuration
Consists of:
• Lab at (x=-7.5, y=18.5) dedicated to automation research (status: NO_POWER).
• Electricity Group comprising:
 – Small electric poles at (x=-0.5, y=11.5), (x=-7.5, y=15.5), (x=-4.5, y=15.5), (x=3.5, y=19.5), (x=1.5, y=22.5),
  along with poles at (x=-7.5, y=16.5) and (x=-8.5, y=13.5),
  and new poles at (x=-10.5, y=18.5), (x=-11.5, y=18.5) and (x=-12.5, y=16.5).
• Steam Engines:
 – Primary engine at (x=-13.5, y=16.5) (now connected via pole at (x=-12.5, y=16.5));
 – Additional engines at (x=-14.5, y=13.5), (x=7.5, y=35.5) and (x=8.5, y=20.5).
• Fluid System Submodule – Boiler Module comprising:
 – Pre-existing Boiler at (x=-13.5, y=19.0) with intermediate pipe at (x=-17.5, y=21.5) (fluid connection failed).
 – Existing new Boiler+Steam Engine Pair originally placed with boiler at (x=-14.0, y=16.5) then repositioned to (x=-10.0, y=22.5) and its associated steam engine at (x=-7.5, y=11.5) (connection unresolved).
 – Additional attempted Boiler+Steam Engine Pair with boiler at (x=-7.0, y=23.5) and steam engine at (x=1.5, y=28.5) (pipe connection remains unresolved).
 – NEW Boiler+Steam Engine Pair successfully placed during the latest steps:
  • Boiler placed at (x=-2.0, y=15.5) (5 coal inserted).
  • Steam Engine placed at (x=11.5, y=13.5).
   – Pipe connection between them failed due to an insufficient number of pipe items.
   – An Electric Pole was placed at (x=16.5, y=13.5), but connecting the Lab to this pole failed because of a shortage of small electric poles.

### Copper Cable Factory at position (x=1.5, y=19.5)
Consists of:
• Assembling Machine at (x=1.5, y=19.5) reconfigured for iron gear wheel production.
• Burner Inserter at (x=1.5, y=17.5).
• Input Chest at (x=2.5, y=17.5).
• Output Chest at (x=1.5, y=21.5).
• Dedicated Copper Buffer Chest at (x=-5.5, y=21.5).
• Dedicated Transport Belt Segment at (x=0.5, y=17.5).
• Additional Burner Inserters at (x=2.5, y=16.5) and (x=3.5, y=17.5).

### Copper Extraction System (adjacent to the copper smelting furnace)
Consists of:
• Extraction Burner Inserter at (x=-3.5, y=23.5) with pickup at (x=-3.5, y=22.5) and drop at (x=-3.5, y=24.5).
• Copper Buffer Chest at (x=-3.5, y=26.5).
• Chest Extraction Burner Inserter at (x=-3.5, y=27.5) with pickup at (x=-3.5, y=26.5) and drop at (x=-3.5, y=28.5).
• Belt Source Inserter at (x=-3.5, y=25.5).

### Extraction Belt Depot at position (x=3.5, y=15.5)
Consists of:
• Wooden Chest at (x=3.5, y=15.5) serving as the belt depot.
• Dedicated Transport Belt Segment at (x=4.5, y=15.5) for copper plate conveyance.
• Depot Burner Inserter at (x=3.5, y=14.5) with pickup at (x=3.5, y=15.5) and drop at (x=3.5, y=13.5).

### Belt Connection Target Setup for Copper Extraction
Consists of:
• Extraction Source: Wooden Chest at (x=3.5, y=15.5).
• Extraction Inserter at (x=4.5, y=15.5) with pickup at (x=3.5, y=15.5) and drop at (x=5.5, y=15.5).
• Manual Transport Belt Chain composed of horizontal segments (e.g. at x=7.5 and x=8.5 along y=15.5) and vertical segments from y=14.5 down to y=11.5 (noting blockages).
• New Target Inserter at (x=8.5, y=9.5) with pickup at (x=8.5, y=10.5) and drop at (x=8.5, y=8.5).
• Belt Chain Burner Inserter Refueling Subsystem with burner inserters at various positions.

### Remote Fluid Integration System at remote region (approximate center: x=-30, y=40)
Consists of:
• Offshore Pump at (x=-30.5, y=37.5) (WORKING).
• Boiler for fluid heating at (x=-29.0, y=33.5).
• Pipe Connection established via a PipeGroup starting at (x=-30.5, y=31.5) and extending to (x=-30.5, y=34.5).
• New segmented pipe connection attempt aimed at linking the Offshore Pump with the New Boiler (targeted near x=-10.0, y=22.5) remains unresolved.

────────────────────────
ERROR TIPS
• Inventory Shortages and Crafting Prerequisites:
 – Verify availability of required items before placement. Multiple errors occurred when attempting to place boilers or steam engines with zero inventory.
 – Before crafting complex machinery, ensure all sub-ingredients (e.g. stone for stone-furnace construction and iron-plates for steam engines) are available, as crafting failures can cascade into placement failures.

• Buildable Area and Position Calculation Errors:
 – Confirm the validity of computed buildable positions. Errors such as a TypeError from invoking a 'Position' object indicate issues in buildable area determination.
 – Pre-check that target tiles are free of obstructions to support successful placement.

• Pipe Connection and Fluid System Issues:
 – Ensure sufficient pipe items are in inventory when establishing connections. Failures with pipe connection attempts (e.g. requiring 57 pipes with none available) necessitate inventory replenishment and careful planning of connection paths.
 – Validate spacing and clear paths when linking boilers to steam engines through pipes.

• Electric Pole and Network Connection Issues:
 – Check that target tiles for electric poles are unoccupied and that the necessary number of poles is available. Errors arising from attempted connection of the Lab to an electric pole (requiring 6 poles but none available) highlight this need.
 – Maintain accurate entity references to prevent errors such as those involving 'NoneType' objects during pole placement.

• General Inventory and Variable Management:
 – Continuously update inventory records after crafting and placement attempts to avoid referencing unavailable resources.
 – Use consistent variable names and validated reference points to prevent misdirected placement actions.

────────────────────────
(NAMESPACE section omitted as no agent‐defined functions were identified.)
